intro: Hastingsia bracteosa, commonly known as the Santa Barbara dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the spring and summer months. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
